sn45.152:4.1: “Mendicants, suppose a tree slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
sn45.152:4.2: If it was cut off at the root, where would it fall?”
sn45.152:4.3: “Sir, it would fall in the direction that it slants, slopes, and inclines.”
sn45.152:4.4: “In the same way, a mendicant who develops the noble eightfold path slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
sn45.152:4.5: And how does a mendicant who develops the noble eightfold path slant, slope, and incline to extinguishment?
sn45.152:4.6: It’s when a mendicant develops right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,
sn45.152:4.7: and right samādhi, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn45.152:4.8: That’s how a mendicant who develops the noble eightfold path slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.”
